page.title: 05AUT/WINT FARMING,CARSPHAIRN
page.content: {SPEANING}Speaning starts in about August.(Speaning means separating the lambs from their mothers).This is done by driving them from the pen and through a race .A man at the end separates the ewes into one pen and the lambs into another. {DRAFT EWE SALE}The ewes are dipped at the same time for the draft ewe sale at Castle Douglas in September.(Draft ewes are 5 years old).The price for a fairly good ewe is around Â£35-Â£40. {LAMB SALES}From August onwards, lambs are sold either store or to kill. { {WINTERING}In about October the stock ewe hogs go to a farm on lower ground, for the winter.Ewes are kept on the hill.The tups go out with the ewes from mid November until the new year.Unless there is heavy snow, the ewes are not fed until about six weeks before lambing time.
